data.title: Average of Five (Ao5)
data.solution:
times = input().split()

if times.count("DNF") == 0:
    times = list(map(float, times))

    times.remove(max(times))  # remove best time
    times.remove(min(times))  # remove worst time

    print("%.2f" % (sum(times)/3))
elif times.count("DNF") == 1:
    times.remove("DNF")  # remove DNF

    times = list(map(float, times))
    times.remove(min(times))  # remove best time

    print("%.2f" % (sum(times) / 3))
else:
    print("DNF")
data.statement:
In official Rubiks Cube competitions the final result of a competitor is calculated by <<removing the best (shortest) and worst (longest)>> time from 5 solves and then taking the <<mean>> of the remaining 3.
However, {{DNF}}s (Did Not Finish) are possible. They mean that on that particular solve the competitor did not finish the solve.
{{DNF}}s are always considered worse than any actual time. So if there is only one {{DNF}} in a set of 5 solves, both that solve and the best (lowest) time are removed.
But if there are 2 or more {{DNF}}s, the entire average is considered a {{DNF}}.

Calculate the <<average of 5>> and, if the final times are valid, output the result <<rounded to 2 decimal places>>. Otherwise output {{DNF}}.
data.stubGenerator:
loopline 5 time:string(100)
write Ao5 or DNF
data.inputDescription: A single line with 5 times (floats with 2 decimal places or {{DNF}}) seperated by spaces
data.outputDescription: The average of 5: a float rounded to 2 decimal places <<or>> {{DNF}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In official Rubiks Cube competitions the final result of a competitor is calculated by removing the best (shortest) and worst (longest) time from 5 solves and then taking the mean of the remaining 3.
However, DNFs (Did Not Finish) are possible. They mean that on that particular solve the competitor did not finish the solve.
DNFs are always considered worse than any actual time. So if there is only one DNF in a set of 5 solves, both that solve and the best (lowest) time are removed.
But if there are 2 or more DNFs, the entire average is considered a DNF.

Calculate the average of 5 and, if the final times are valid, output the result rounded to 2 decimal places. Otherwise output DNF.
Input
A single line with 5 times (floats with 2 decimal places or DNF) seperated by spaces
Output
The average of 5: a float rounded to 2 decimal places or DNF
Constraints
Example
Input
4.62 4.78 5.68 5.19 4.50
Output
4.86
